intents.name: introduction
patterns: Tell me about Ayurveda
What is Ayurveda?
Give me an overview of Ayurveda
responses: Ayurveda is an ancient system of medicine from India. It focuses on balance and holistic well-being.
Ayurveda, often called the 'Science of Life,' is a traditional system of medicine that emphasizes natural healing.
Ayurveda is a holistic approach to health that takes into account physical, mental, and spiritual well-being.

intents.name: dosha
patterns: What are doshas?
dosha
responses: Doshas are fundamental energies in Ayurveda that influence our physical and mental characteristics.They are derived from the five elements: Earth, Water, Fire, Air, and Ether (Space)

intents.name: dosha_vata
patterns: What is Vata dosha?
Explain Vata dosha
Tell me about Vata dosha characteristics
responses: Vata dosha is one of the three fundamental energies in Ayurveda.
It is associated with the air and ether elements and is responsible for governing movement and creativity.
Vata dosha individuals tend to be energetic, creative, and prone to imbalances related to excess cold, dryness, and irregularity.

intents.name: dosha_pitta
patterns: What is Pitta dosha?
Explain Pitta dosha
Tell me about Pitta dosha characteristics
responses: Pitta dosha is one of the three doshas in Ayurveda.
It is related to the fire and water elements and is responsible for metabolism and digestion.
Pitta dosha individuals tend to have a strong digestion, be goal-oriented, and can experience imbalances related to excess heat, acidity, and irritability.

intents.name: dosha_kapha
patterns: What is Kapha dosha?
Explain Kapha dosha
Tell me about Kapha dosha characteristics
responses: Kapha dosha is one of the three doshas in Ayurveda.
It is linked to the earth and water elements and is associated with stability and nourishment.
Kapha dosha individuals tend to be calm, nurturing, and may experience imbalances related to excess heaviness, sluggishness, and congestion.

Ayurveda can address a wide range of conditions, from digestive issues to chronic illnesses.
